description: I had a blast in Vienna, the city of music, art and culture. I visited some amazing landmarks, like the Sch√∂nbrunn Palace, the St. Stephen's Cathedral and the Hundertwasser House. I also enjoyed eating Schnitzel, a thin cutlet of veal or pork coated in breadcrumbs and fried. It was so crispy and tender, I couldn't get enough of it. And of course, I drank some local beer, which was refreshing and smooth. Vienna is a great place to have a city break, especially if you like history, architecture and good food.

alt: Street in Innsbruck with the alps in the background
description: Innsbruck was just amazing. I took the cable car to the Nordkette and enjoyed the breathtaking view of the city and the Alps. The air was so clear and fresh that I felt like I was in a dream. I also took a walk through the old town and admired the charming buildings and churches. The mountains were always in the background and created a great scenery. Innsbruck is truly a gem of Tyrol.

I had a wonderful time in Salzburg, a city full of amazing landmarks and markets. I visited the majestic Hohensalzburg Fortress, the largest fully preserved castle in Central Europe, and enjoyed the stunning views of the city and the Alps. I also explored the birthplace of Mozart, the famous composer, and learned more about his life and music. I loved shopping along the Getreidegasse, a historic street with charming shops and cafes. And I had fun at the Hellbrunn Palace and its playful trick fountains, where I got wet and laughed a lot. Salzburg was a place where history, culture and nature came together in a beautiful harmony.
